24#include <sys/cdefs.h>
25__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: nouveau_nvkm_engine_device_tegra.c,v 1.2 2018/08/27 04:58:31 riastradh Exp $");
26
27#include <core/tegra.h>
28#ifdef CONFIG_NOUVEAU_PLATFORM_DRIVER
29#include "priv.h"
30
31static int
32nvkm_device_tegra_power_up(struct nvkm_device_tegra *tdev)
33{
34 int ret;
35
36 ret = regulator_enable(tdev->vdd);
37 if (ret)
38 goto err_power;
39
40 ret = clk_prepare_enable(tdev->clk);
41 if (ret)
42 goto err_clk;
43 ret = clk_prepare_enable(tdev->clk_pwr);
44 if (ret)
45 goto err_clk_pwr;
46 clk_set_rate(tdev->clk_pwr, 204000000);
47 udelay(10);
48
49 reset_control_assert(tdev->rst);
50 udelay(10);
51
52 ret = tegra_powergate_remove_clamping(TEGRA_POWERGATE_3D);
53 if (ret)
54 goto err_clamp;
55 udelay(10);
56
57 reset_control_deassert(tdev->rst);
58 udelay(10);
59
60 return 0;
61
62err_clamp:
63 clk_disable_unprepare(tdev->clk_pwr);
64err_clk_pwr:
65 clk_disable_unprepare(tdev->clk);
66err_clk:
67 regulator_disable(tdev->vdd);
68err_power:
69 return ret;
70}
71
72static int
73nvkm_device_tegra_power_down(struct nvkm_device_tegra *tdev)
74{
75 reset_control_assert(tdev->rst);
76 udelay(10);
77
78 clk_disable_unprepare(tdev->clk_pwr);
79 clk_disable_unprepare(tdev->clk);
80 udelay(10);
81
82 return regulator_disable(tdev->vdd);
83}
84
85static void
86nvkm_device_tegra_probe_iommu(struct nvkm_device_tegra *tdev)
87{
88#if IS_ENABLED(CONFIG_IOMMU_API)
89 struct device *dev = &tdev->pdev->dev;
90 unsigned long pgsize_bitmap;
91 int ret;
92
93 if (!tdev->func->iommu_bit)
94 return;
95
96 mutex_init(&tdev->iommu.mutex);
97
98 if (iommu_present(&platform_bus_type)) {
99 tdev->iommu.domain = iommu_domain_alloc(&platform_bus_type);
100 if (IS_ERR(tdev->iommu.domain))
101 goto error;
102
103 /*
104 * A IOMMU is only usable if it supports page sizes smaller
105 * or equal to the system's PAGE_SIZE, with a preference if
106 * both are equal.
107 */
108 pgsize_bitmap = tdev->iommu.domain->ops->pgsize_bitmap;
109 if (pgsize_bitmap & PAGE_SIZE) {
110 tdev->iommu.pgshift = PAGE_SHIFT;
111 } else {
112 tdev->iommu.pgshift = fls(pgsize_bitmap & ~PAGE_MASK);
113 if (tdev->iommu.pgshift == 0) {
114 dev_warn(dev, "unsupported IOMMU page size\n");
115 goto free_domain;
116 }
117 tdev->iommu.pgshift -= 1;
118 }
119
120 ret = iommu_attach_device(tdev->iommu.domain, dev);
121 if (ret)
122 goto free_domain;
123
124 ret = nvkm_mm_init(&tdev->iommu.mm, 0,
125 (1ULL << tdev->func->iommu_bit) >>
126 tdev->iommu.pgshift, 1);
127 if (ret)
128 goto detach_device;
129 }
130
131 return;
132
133detach_device:
134 iommu_detach_device(tdev->iommu.domain, dev);
135
136free_domain:
137 iommu_domain_free(tdev->iommu.domain);
138
139error:
140 tdev->iommu.domain = NULL;
141 tdev->iommu.pgshift = 0;
142 dev_err(dev, "cannot initialize IOMMU MM\n");
143#endif
144}
145
146static void
147nvkm_device_tegra_remove_iommu(struct nvkm_device_tegra *tdev)
148{
149#if IS_ENABLED(CONFIG_IOMMU_API)
150 if (tdev->iommu.domain) {
151 nvkm_mm_fini(&tdev->iommu.mm);
152 iommu_detach_device(tdev->iommu.domain, tdev->device.dev);
153 iommu_domain_free(tdev->iommu.domain);
154 }
155#endif
156}
157
158static struct nvkm_device_tegra *
159nvkm_device_tegra(struct nvkm_device *device)
160{
161 return container_of(device, struct nvkm_device_tegra, device);
162}
163
164static struct resource *
165nvkm_device_tegra_resource(struct nvkm_device *device, unsigned bar)
166{
167 struct nvkm_device_tegra *tdev = nvkm_device_tegra(device);
168 return platform_get_resource(tdev->pdev, IORESOURCE_MEM, bar);
169}
170
171#ifdef __NetBSD__
172static bus_space_tag_t
173nvkm_device_tegra_resource_tag(struct nvkm_device *device, unsigned bar)
174{
175 XXX FIXME!
176}
177#endif
178
179static resource_size_t
180nvkm_device_tegra_resource_addr(struct nvkm_device *device, unsigned bar)
181{
182 struct resource *res = nvkm_device_tegra_resource(device, bar);
183 return res ? res->start : 0;
184}
185
186static resource_size_t
187nvkm_device_tegra_resource_size(struct nvkm_device *device, unsigned bar)
188{
189 struct resource *res = nvkm_device_tegra_resource(device, bar);
190 return res ? resource_size(res) : 0;
191}
192
193static irqreturn_t
194nvkm_device_tegra_intr(int irq, void *arg)
195{
196 struct nvkm_device_tegra *tdev = arg;
197 struct nvkm_mc *mc = tdev->device.mc;
198 bool handled = false;
199 if (likely(mc)) {
200 nvkm_mc_intr_unarm(mc);
201 nvkm_mc_intr(mc, &handled);
202 nvkm_mc_intr_rearm(mc);
203 }
204 return handled ? IRQ_HANDLED : IRQ_NONE;
205}
206
207static void
208nvkm_device_tegra_fini(struct nvkm_device *device, bool suspend)
209{
210 struct nvkm_device_tegra *tdev = nvkm_device_tegra(device);
211 if (tdev->irq) {
212 free_irq(tdev->irq, tdev);
213 tdev->irq = 0;
214 };
215}
216
217static int
218nvkm_device_tegra_init(struct nvkm_device *device)
219{
220 struct nvkm_device_tegra *tdev = nvkm_device_tegra(device);
221 int irq, ret;
222
223 irq = platform_get_irq_byname(tdev->pdev, "stall");
224 if (irq < 0)
225 return irq;
226
227 ret = request_irq(irq, nvkm_device_tegra_intr,
228 IRQF_SHARED, "nvkm", tdev);
229 if (ret)
230 return ret;
231
232 tdev->irq = irq;
233 return 0;
234}
235
236static void *
237nvkm_device_tegra_dtor(struct nvkm_device *device)
238{
239 struct nvkm_device_tegra *tdev = nvkm_device_tegra(device);
240 nvkm_device_tegra_power_down(tdev);
241 nvkm_device_tegra_remove_iommu(tdev);
242 return tdev;
243}
244
245static const struct nvkm_device_func
246nvkm_device_tegra_func = {
247 .tegra = nvkm_device_tegra,
248 .dtor = nvkm_device_tegra_dtor,
249 .init = nvkm_device_tegra_init,
250 .fini = nvkm_device_tegra_fini,
251#ifdef __NetBSD__
252 .resource_tag = nvkm_device_tegra_resource_tag,
253#endif
254 .resource_addr = nvkm_device_tegra_resource_addr,
255 .resource_size = nvkm_device_tegra_resource_size,
256 .cpu_coherent = false,
257};
258
259int
260nvkm_device_tegra_new(const struct nvkm_device_tegra_func *func,
261 struct platform_device *pdev,
262 const char *cfg, const char *dbg,
263 bool detect, bool mmio, u64 subdev_mask,
264 struct nvkm_device **pdevice)
265{
266 struct nvkm_device_tegra *tdev;
267 int ret;
268
269 if (!(tdev = kzalloc(sizeof(*tdev), GFP_KERNEL)))
270 return -ENOMEM;
271
272 tdev->func = func;
273 tdev->pdev = pdev;
274 tdev->irq = -1;
275
276 tdev->vdd = devm_regulator_get(&pdev->dev, "vdd");
277 if (IS_ERR(tdev->vdd)) {
278 ret = PTR_ERR(tdev->vdd);
279 goto free;
280 }
281
282 tdev->rst = devm_reset_control_get(&pdev->dev, "gpu");
283 if (IS_ERR(tdev->rst)) {
284 ret = PTR_ERR(tdev->rst);
285 goto free;
286 }
287
288 tdev->clk = devm_clk_get(&pdev->dev, "gpu");
289 if (IS_ERR(tdev->clk)) {
290 ret = PTR_ERR(tdev->clk);
291 goto free;
292 }
293
294 tdev->clk_pwr = devm_clk_get(&pdev->dev, "pwr");
295 if (IS_ERR(tdev->clk_pwr)) {
296 ret = PTR_ERR(tdev->clk_pwr);
297 goto free;
298 }
299
300 nvkm_device_tegra_probe_iommu(tdev);
301
302 ret = nvkm_device_tegra_power_up(tdev);
303 if (ret)
304 goto remove;
305
306 tdev->gpu_speedo = tegra_sku_info.gpu_speedo_value;
307 ret = nvkm_device_ctor(&nvkm_device_tegra_func, NULL, &pdev->dev,
308 NVKM_DEVICE_TEGRA, pdev->id, NULL,
309 cfg, dbg, detect, mmio, subdev_mask,
310 &tdev->device);
311 if (ret)
312 goto powerdown;
313
314 *pdevice = &tdev->device;
315
316 return 0;
317
318powerdown:
319 nvkm_device_tegra_power_down(tdev);
320remove:
321 nvkm_device_tegra_remove_iommu(tdev);
322free:
323 kfree(tdev);
324 return ret;
325}
326#else
327int
328nvkm_device_tegra_new(const struct nvkm_device_tegra_func *func,
329 struct platform_device *pdev,
330 const char *cfg, const char *dbg,
331 bool detect, bool mmio, u64 subdev_mask,
332 struct nvkm_device **pdevice)
333{
334 return -ENOSYS;
335}
336#endif
